cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest along/just north of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys, eastern Gulf of Mexico and eventually the Florida Panhandle–Alabama coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Pensacola–Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef (including Florida Bay) and the Florida Keys, plus portions of central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Bahamas, Florida Keys, southern and central Florida Peninsula, Florida west coast, Florida Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast, and interior Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of northeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches possible with isolated higher totals; could trigger urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk and minor coastal flooding possible along northeast Florida beaches
